publication.abstract: Hapi is a new dynamic programming algorithm that ignores uninformative states and state transitions in order to efficiently compute minimum-recombinant and maximum likelihood haplotypes. When applied to a dataset containing 103 families, Hapi performs 3.8 and 320 times faster than state-of-the-art algorithms. Because Hapi infers both minimum-recombinant and maximum likelihood haplotypes and applies to related individuals, the haplotypes it infers are highly accurate over extended genomic distances Â© 2010 Williams et al.; licensee BioMed Central Ltd.
publication.title: Rapid haplotype inference for nuclear families

summary.description: Hapi is a program that efficiently infers minimum recombinant and maximum likelihood haplotypes for nuclear families.
